definition: variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]

sentences.english: The escaped prisoner beat about for some place to hide.
sentences.chinese: 逃犯仓惶寻找个藏身之处。

sentences.english: The others run off in panic, leaving one of their prisoners behind.
sentences.chinese: 其余的丢下一个俘虏仓惶逃走。

sentences.english: The defeated army had to retreat hastily to the coast.
sentences.chinese: 败军被迫仓惶向海岸撤退。

sentences.english: The defeated army had to retreat hastily from the field of battle.
sentences.chinese: 这支被打败的部队被迫从战场上仓惶撤退。

sentences.english: Cao Cao lost horribly and almost got killed on the way back.
sentences.chinese: 曹操仓惶战败，几乎死在溃逃途中。

sentences.english: Then they took their money and skedaddled as the housing market collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 然后，他们把自己的钱，仓惶逃走随着住房市场崩溃。

sentences.english: They tumble blindly as they make their way.
sentences.chinese: 他们仓惶盲目地寻找著出路。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to run away/to flee in disarray
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
